title:
Distinct neutrino signatures of quark deconfinement in accretion-induced
  collapse of white dwarfs
authors: Juno C. L. Chan, Harry Ho-Yin Ng, Patrick Chi-Kit Cheong
abstract:
We present the first seconds-long general relativistic neutrino-radiation
simulations of accretion-induced collapse (AIC) of white dwarfs using
hadron-quark matter equations of state with different onset densities and
latent heat of the first-order quantum chromodynamics phase transition (PT).
The collapse forms a proto-neutron star that continues contracting due to
neutrino cooling and the softening effect of mixed nuclear-quark matter,
followed by a second bounce triggered by the PT to deconfined quark matter,
leading to a stable remnant of proto-hybrid star. The resultant distinct
neutrino bursts and narrow mass range of AIC events offer critical insights
into the existence and properties of hybrid stars, including constraints on the
onset density of PT.
